201.title: Android Things 101
201.description: In this talk Raul will explain the basic concepts of Android Things (Android for IoT), explain how to setup the development environment for it and show how easy is to work with the different peripherals. For this, he'll use the most popular Dev Kit for Android Things: A Raspberry Pi with a Rainbow HAT (which has lots of sensors, input and output devices).

202.title: Android Instant Apps
202.description: This session will introduce the audience to the concept of Android Instant Apps. It highlights some tools that can be used and demonstrates what to keep in mind when developing an instant app.

204.title: Using Kotlin in production
204.description: Kotlin has fast become the new hotness in the Android world - but what is the reality of adding it to an app which is rapidly being built for a fast growing startup? In this talk we'll cover how we went about adding Kotlin to the Monzo app, why we made those choices and how it went.

205.title: AR Core - An Introduction
205.description: With more than two billion active devices, Android is the largest mobile platform in the world. And for the past nine years, Google have worked to create a rich set of tools, frameworks and APIs that deliver developers‚Äô creations to people everywhere.   In this talk, we'll go through some of the features of AR Core.

206.title: I like the way you move
206.description:
Good use of animations can not only help make your app‚Äôs UI more intuitive, but can also build emotional attachment with your users.

Mark Allison will explore the subtleties of why some animations work where others don‚Äôt; The distinct components of effective animation; and, of course, some detailed worked examples of how to create amazing Android animations.

207.title: Flutter - evolving mobile
207.description:
Mobile platforms such as iOS and Android are almost 10 years old. They‚Äôve matured becoming more stable and richer in features, creating a market bigger than their creator‚Äôs expectations. Along with their stunning success, customer‚Äôs appetite for impressive skilfully tailored user experiences has grown as well. 

But with the growing demand for quality, is there any way to make mobile development easier whilst still delivering stunning apps? What about making development more pleasant; is that really possible?

Flutter is a new platform for mobile development which is ready to change the way we develop high performance, customised mobile applications. Built from the ground up on learnings taken from existing platforms, it rethinks the way UI works. It gives absolute freedom in creating user experiences, regardless of the underlying target platform.

301.title: WordPress + PWA = üíù
301.description: About 50% of sites in the web are powered by Content Management Systems; and that trend is growing. Integrating Progressive Technologies into the workflow of platforms such as WordPress and other CMSes is of paramount importance for ensuring that users get an awesome experience in these environments. In this talk we will discuss the challenges involved in the integration of progressive technologies with CMSes in general and WordPress in particular, and present a working proof of concept of how such an integration would work in the context of WordPress.

302.title: Solving Layout Problems with CSS Grid and Friends
302.description: CSS Grid Layout launched into the majority of our browsers in 2017. As designers and developers have started to use Grid I‚Äôve been answering a lot of questions about the specification. In this talk I‚Äôll answer some of the common questions about Grid Layout in production - from dealing with old browsers to what might come next in CSS for layout. There will be plenty of practical tips for you to use in your projects today.

303.title: V8 internals for JavaScript developers
303.description: This presentation demonstrates how learning just a little bit about JavaScript engine internals can help you improve the run-time performance of your JavaScript code ‚Äî not just in V8 specifically, but across all JavaScript engines!

304.title: Let Firebase help you to build better Web apps
304.description:
What is the first thing that comes to your mind when you are starting to develop your product? You need to think about all sort of features. How you are going to grow your app. Engage your audience and make money in the process, right?

What if you could choose a platform to build your app with confidence, without the need of managing infrastructure, trusted by companies like The New York Times, The Economist, Shazam and much more. Firebase gives you the tools and infrastructure you need to build better apps and grow businesses. Join this talk and learn how to overcome the challenges of build extraordinary web apps using Firebase.

305.title: AMP: A Library for Beautiful and Responsive Sites
305.description: It is common knowledge that Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP) are fast. Less commonly known is that AMP is also a fantastic library for building user-friendly, responsive web sites. I'm going to talk about how AMP makes it easy to create beautiful interactive websites.

306.title: Designing an empathic Google Assistant
306.description:
We are in an age of blending horizons and blurring devices brought alive by ambient assistive companions. Everything is talking, everything has a brain...and we respond to these "presences" with many of the same feelings and reactions as if they were sentient beings. It's not our fault. It's 150,000 years of human hardwiring telling us that a speaking thing is not just an ‚Äúit,‚Äù it‚Äôs alive and aware and connecting with us. With ‚Äúears‚Äù and ‚Äúeyes‚Äù sensing, it becomes even more emotionally compelling and/or complex.

How might we design for Emotional Intelligence to make people feel that these experiences are useful, familiar, comfortable, positive, supportive and trust-worthy.

307.title: The evolution of asynchronous JavaScript
307.description: One of JavaScript‚Äôs strengths is how it handles asynchrony. Async is one of the most important and often misunderstood part of Javascript or any other language. We will see how dealing with asynchrony in JavaScript evolved over the years. It all started with callbacks, it landed on generators and...

401.title: Google Apps Script - gateway to Google APIS
401.description: Apps Script is Google's language for automating G Suite. It is based on JavaScript, runs in the cloud, and has native  access to the underlying APIS that power G Suite Apps. It also provides a powerful serverless environment for working in an authenticated environment to connect to other services and APIS. Apps Script simplifies integrating G Suite apps with other APIS, and is an ideal environment for mashing up prototypes in a startup environment, even if the end state platform is ends up being something other than G Suite.

402.title: Startup Tech: how not to suck as CTO
402.description: Technology decisions at a startup can make, or break, their success. Mastering the art of making those choices isn't easy, and arguably, knowing how to code makes it harder. We'll talk about that, and offer some ideas to help mitigate the risks.

403.title: The Google Analytics of Things
403.description: Did you know Google Analytics isn't just for website tracking? Since launching Google Analytics in November 2005 the Internet has radically changed moving away from static content to fully interactive web applications. Google Analytics has also radically changed moving away from website pageviews allowing you to analyse virtually any event on any platform. This talk is designed to highlight some of the Google Analytics features available to developers you may not be aware of inspiring you to look at your analytics problems and opportunities in new ways. For example, we look at how Google Analytics can be used as part of the Internet of Things, using low cost computing like Raspberry Pis for recording and analysing everything from sensor data to physical switches. We also look at bridging offline and asynchronous tracking sending measurement data in batches when connectivity is reestablished as well as pushing data from third party APIs into Google Analytics using free tools. After this talk you'll hopefully look at Google Analytics in a completely different way.

404.title: Idea to Launch
404.description: This talk explores Alessia‚Äôs entrepreneurial journey and what she learned bringing ideas to life. After co-founding her own digital product studio Code & Wander and working with top brands, she will share her experiences and discuss what it takes to go from an idea to launch.

405.title: Beta to Live
405.description: With the experience of launching products at her own digital agency, Code & Wander, Alessia discusses the steps required to move a product from beta to live. From testing to constant iterations she outlines the dos and don‚Äôts.

406.title: Customer Acquisition: Navigating Your Way to Success

407.title: Raising a Seed Round
407.description: How to raise a seed round from London based investors.

408.title: Digital Marketing: What not to do for your business
408.description: In this extremely practical session, Daniel and Ciaran, Hosts of the iTunes top 10 "Digital Marketing Podcast", share the mistakes and techniques they wished they avoided and what they did that worked. Full of practical hands on techniques and tools, attendees will leave with a wealth of experience and tools they can use straight away. Attendees will also receive a toolkit listing 50 of the most useful digital marketing tools and access to a library of podcasts to help them implement their digital activity.

501.title: Kubernetes: hyper-scale computing for the masses
501.description:
Kubernetes was started in 2014 by Google, based off their experience running production systems at huge scale for more than 10 years. A completely open source project, Kubernetes helps orchestrate and manage applications running across 5 servers, or 5,000.

By providing a meaningful API to interact with, it's possible to deploy code rapidly and consistently, and even to multiple cloud platforms at a time. This helps teams focus on their own applications, instead of the systems on which they run.

In this talk I'll introduce Kubernetes and show how easy it is to deploy a Docker-ized application to GKE, Google's managed Kubernetes-as-a-Service.

502.title: End-to-end streaming analytics on Google Cloud Platform
502.description: Do you think you can write a system to get data from sensors across the world, do real time analytics, and display the data on a dashboard in under 100 lines of code? Would you like to add some monitoring and autoscaling too? And what about serverless? In this talk I'll show you all the technologies GCP offers to build such a system reliably and at scale.

503.title: Creative Applications of Machine Learning
503.description: Over the past couple of years, there has been increasing interest in applying the latest advances in machine learning to creative projects in art, music, film, theatre and beyond. From Google's DeepDream and style transfer to the world's first computer-generated musical playing in London's West End, more and more creative AI projects are moving beyond the world of research and academia into the public eye. This talk will give an overview of creative projects using RNNs, ConvNets, GANs and other models.

504.title: An implementation of generalised curriculum learning using Tensorflow and Keras
504.description: In this talk, we focus on a technique that allow a machine learning model to minimize two different cost functions (each representing a different task) together, by gradually switching between the tasks. This technique can be thought as a generalisation of curriculum learning, and can in principle be applied to n tasks. We present the results of an experiment conducted on the MNIST dataset and implemented using Tensorflow and Keras.

505.title: Intro to Google Cloud storage and computing
505.description: There's a lot to grok in cloud computing, and trying to understand it all can be daunting. In this session, Marc will walk us through a hands-on, practical guided tour of the Google Cloud Platform, with a particular focus on storage and computing.

506.title: Lowering the barriers: Machine Learning and Cloud
506.description: Marc will provide an overview of Google's AI APIs, which offer easy access to rich, pre-trained models via a single API call with lots of demos, and a brief overview of Cloud ML Engine, which allows training and hosting of custom machine learning models in the Cloud.

508.title: Collaborative Machine Learning using Kubernetes and Jupyter
508.description: The Jupyter notebook is the established development environment of the data scientist, typically running on a laptop or remote server. However the default Jupyter server presents challenges which make doing collaborative machine learning at scale difficult. In this talk, I'll discuss these challenges of security, scalability, and collaboration, and describe the Kubernetes-based infrastructure we‚Äôve built at ASI Data Science to overcome them.
